agency_desc: A Hope Center exists to provide life transforming services related to pregnancy and sexual integrity.
service_name: EARN WHILE YOU LEARN - COLUMBIA CITY
service_description: Provides a parenting education program with incentives offered at each session. Topics include child care, budgeting, health and safety, discipline, and more. Participants earn coupons that may be used to purchase cribs, car seats, baby furniture, maternity and infant clothing, and other new baby supplies.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment to register.
site_eligibility: Pregnant women  -OR- parents of a baby under 12 months

agency_name: UNITED STATES DEPARTMENT OF AGRICULTURE RURAL DEVELOPMENT - INDIANA
agency_desc: A federal government agency responsible for issues related development and revitalization in rural Indiana by financing home buyers and rehabilitation projects.
site_name: USDA RURAL DEVELOPMENT - COLUMBIA CITY AREA
service_name: SINGLE FAMILY HOUSING HOME REPAIR LOANS - COLUMBIA CITY AREA OFFICE
service_description: Offers loans to eligible applicants to purchase homes in eligible rural areas.  Offers a loan to eligible rural homeowners for modifications needed to make their home accessible or remove health and safety hazards. Maximum loan amount is $20,000, with a 1% interest rate. There is a $10,000 lifetime limit on grant funds for eligible seniors, 62 and older,. Grant recipients must repay if home is sold during first three years.
site_details: Call for information or to receive application.
site_eligibility: Living in eligible rural area in Adams, Allen, DeKalb, Huntington, Lagrange, Noble, Steuben, Wabash, Wells, or Whitley County -- US Citizen or permanent resident -- Own and occupy home

agency_name: UNITED STATES DEPARTMENT OF AGRICULTURE RURAL DEVELOPMENT - INDIANA
agency_desc: A federal government agency responsible for issues related development and revitalization in rural Indiana by financing home buyers and rehabilitation projects.
site_name: USDA RURAL DEVELOPMENT - COLUMBIA CITY AREA
service_name: SINGLE FAMILY HOUSING DIRECT HOME LOANS - COLUMBIA CITY AREA OFFICE
service_description: Provides loans to rural homeowners with low to very-low-income to purchase, repair or improve their homes, or to remove health and safety hazards. Qualified repairs may include new roof, siding, or windows, new septic system or furnace/AC, or new kitchen cabinets. Interest rate is contingent on applicant's income.
site_details: Call for information or to receive application.
site_eligibility: Living in eligible rural area in Adams, Allen, DeKalb, Huntington, Lagrange, Noble, Steuben, Wabash, Wells, and Whitley County -- US Citizen or permanent resident -- Own and occupy the home -- Low income (limits vary by county) -- Ability to repay the loan -- Satisfactory credit history

agency_desc: Our mission is to strengthen our communities and to improve the health and well-being of those we are privileged to serve. We use evidence based practices that treat the whole person. Our team of board-certified psychiatrists and psychologists, highly trained and certified therapists, nurses, and case workers deliver comprehensive care and treatment for mental health conditions.
service_description: Offers outpatient treatment for adults and youth experiencing a mental health issue or psychiatric disorder, such as anger management, anxiety, attention deficit/hyperactivity disorder (ADHD), bi-polar disorder, depression, post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD), or schizophrenia. Services include an initial assessment as well as individual, group, and/or family counseling. Case management, psychiatric medication services, home-based services, community-based psychiatric rehabilitation, supported employment services, and residential programs are available to eligible patients receiving treatment from this center.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization providing free health services to northern Indiana persons in need regardless of ability to pay.
service_description: Offers medical care to uninsured or underinsured children and adults in northern Indiana, regardless of ability to pay. Care is provided by volunteer, licensed doctors and nurses. Available services include basic primary care, treatment of acute illnesses and chronic health conditions, disease prevention and screening, physical exams, and women's/men's health screenings. The clinic is unable to provide immunizations; treatment for sexually transmitted infections or diseases; obstetric services; care for mental or behavioral health problems, worker's compensation injuries, or major medical issues; and disability claims. Referrals may be given for lab testing, imaging, specialty care, optometry, and dental care.
site_details: Walk in; patients will be seen on a first-come, first-served basis. -- Masks are required for the duration of visit.
site_eligibility: Age 65 or under -- Living in northern Indiana -- Uninsured or underinsured with high deductible/premium

agency_desc: A faith-based nonprofit that provides transitional housing to the homeless and domestic violence victims.
service_description: Provides transitional housing to homeless individuals in need. Residents may stay up to four months while working to obtain employment, permanent housing, and move toward self-sufficiency. Services include case management, counseling, budgeting classes, life-skills training, and parenting education. Emergency intake may be available for domestic violence victims.
site_details: Call the office for a phone assessment; a face-to-face interview will be scheduled.
site_eligibility: Homeless -- Men without children, women with or without children (boys up to age 13) -- Satisfactory drug screening -- Satisfactory criminal history -- Agree to abide all house rules

agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.
site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision" -- Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Maintains records of all births and deaths that occur in the County and provides certified copies of birth and death certificates for fixed fees.
site_details: Walk in, download application from website, or call to have application sent by mail. -- Bring or mail in completed application, required documentation, and payment. -- Indiana birth certificates and death records may also be requested online at www.vitalchek.com; this service is offered by a third-party and is not directly affiliated with the health department.
site_eligibility: Births/deaths occurring in the County -- Individual named on the birth certificate, parent, or other adult with a legal right to the certificate

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Provides inspections, permits, code enforcement, and other services to protect the health and safety of Whitley County residents. Regulates drainage and septic systems, wells, public swimming pools, tattoo parlors, and food service establishments in the county. Investigates reports of sanitation violations, substandard housing conditions, air or water pollution, and safety hazards posed by vacant buildings. Offers information and referrals regarding household health and environmental hazards such as mold, lead, radon, tap water contamination, mosquitoes, and rodents.
site_details: Call for information, to request services, or to make a report.

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization providing assistance to those in need.
service_description: Provides financial assistance for people in need to help pay on essential utilities, such as a gas, electric or water bill. Assistance may range from $75 to $225, but is contingent on funding availability. Funds cannot be applied to accounts that are already disconnected. Households are restricted on the number of times they may apply for assistance within a given year. Limited service area.
site_details: Call for an appointment
site_eligibility: At or below 150% of the Federal Poverty Level -- In financial hardship (due to unemployment, divorce, medical circumstances, etc.) -- Must reach out to township trustee and Bright point before service can be provided.

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization providing assistance to those in need.
service_description: Provides vouchers for people in need to redeem for hygiene supplies at First Church of God. One bag per household may include items such as soap, shampoo, toothpaste, bathroom tissue, and more.
site_details: Walk in -- Call for appointment
site_eligibility: In financial hardship -- Visits are limited to once per month

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization providing assistance to those in need.
service_description: Provides assistance to individuals and families who are affected by the results of COVID-19, fire, flood, tornado and other man-made and natural disasters. Emergency service personnel are also served through our canteen program.
site_details: Call for information.
site_eligibility: Persons affected by disaster in Whitley County

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization providing assistance to those in need.
service_description: Provides a diaper bag full of items to parents in need of baby items.
site_details: Call for information
site_eligibility: New Parents --  One per household

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization providing assistance to those in need.
service_description: Provides vouchers for the local laundry mats within Whitely County.
site_details: Call for information.
site_eligibility: In financial hardship

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization providing assistance to those in need.
service_description: Offers vouchers to assist individuals who are seeking employment, or are newly hired, with work clothing.
site_details: Call for information.
site_eligibility: Living or employed in Whitley County -- Newly hired -- Required by workplace for employment.

agency_desc: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools within the district.
service_description: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools in this school district. Provides student transportation services and maintains information on school locations, enrollment, fees, and curricula. District provides information regarding special education services for students age 3-22 with disabilities.

agency_desc: Represents the state of Indiana in felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions, conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic violations, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.
service_description: Files, modifies, and enforces court-ordered child support cases in Whitley County.
site_details: To apply for child support or request child support enforcement or modification, call the prosecutor's office to schedule an appointment. -- For payment information, call the Indiana Kids Line.
site_eligibility: To File for Child Support Assistance -- Living in Whitley County -- Parent, guardian, aunt, uncle, or grandparent who has physical custody of a child (ages 0-18) -- Requiring financial support from a noncustodial parent of the child

agency_desc: Represents the state of Indiana in felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions, conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic violations, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.
service_description: Provides advocacy, information, referrals, and support services to crime victims and witnesses in Whitley County. Assists in the filing of restraining or protective orders, offers court accompaniment services, and provides information about case status, victim compensation, victim rights, and the legal process.
site_details: Call or walk in for more information.
site_eligibility: Victims and witnesses of major crimes in Whitley County

service_description: Represents the state of Indiana in all felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions resulting from crimes committed in Whitley County. The prosecutor's office also conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic laws, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.
site_details: Call or walk in for more information.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.
site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment.
site_schedule: Mon, Tues, and Thurs 9am-3pm; Wed and Fri 9am-noon
site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.

agency_desc: Coordinates emergency management programs and response measures.
service_description: Responds during a disaster or large-scale emergency in Whitley County, assists with the recovery efforts afterwards, and takes steps to prevent or lessen the effects of future disasters.
site_details: Call for information. For emergency assistance, call 9-1-1.
site_schedule: Mon-Fri 8am-4:30pm -- On call for emergency daily 24 hours
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement services and maintains the correctional facility for Whitley County.
service_description: Maintains the Whitley County correctional institution used to detain persons who are in lawful custody, including accused persons awaiting trial and those who have been convicted of a crime and are serving a sentence of less than one year.
site_details: Call or visit the website for scheduling details.
site_eligibility: To visit: Must be on the inmate's approved visitor list -- Age 18 or older

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement services and maintains the correctional facility for Whitley County.
service_description: Provides law enforcement, crime prevention, and criminal investigation services and administers county correctional facilities in Whitley County. Operates a 24-hour dispatch service for police officers, firefighters, and medics (ambulances) in Whitley County. A seven-digit dispatch number is provided for nonemergency dispatch calls. For emergency assistance, persons should call 9-1-1.
site_details: Call 9-1-1 for emergency police, fire, or medical assistance. For nonemergency requests or reports, call the office during normal business hours. nonemergency dispatch number.
site_eligibility: Open; serves Whitley County

agency_desc: The County Clerk maintains records of all civil and criminal court activities, administers jury draw, child support collections, and voter registration, issues marriage licenses and records state tax liens.
service_description: Issues, provides, and maintains marriage licenses issued in the county. No witnesses, blood tests, or waiting period are required to obtain one. Both applicants must appear at the time of application. Marriages must take place within 60 days of the marriage license being issued.
site_details: Walk in. Marriage license forms may be completed in advance online or in the clerk's office.
site_eligibility: Marriage license: Both parties at least age 18 (call or visit website for exceptions) -- At least one applicant from this county -OR- both from out of state -- Certified copies: License must have been issued in this county

agency_desc: The County Clerk maintains records of all civil and criminal court activities, administers jury draw, child support collections, and voter registration, issues marriage licenses and records state tax liens.
service_description: Processes court-ordered child support payments in the county and provides records of payment history. Payer and payee must keep their names and addresses current with this office; any changes must be made in writing.
site_details: Payment history print out: Walk in to obtain. -- Update name/address: Walk in or mail changes. -- Payment Information: Visit website or call the Indiana Kids Line.
site_schedule: Indiana Kids Line (Payment Information): Recorded information daily 24 hours; Live assistance Mon-Fri 7am-6pm
site_eligibility: Parents ordered by the court to pay or receive child support

agency_desc: The County Clerk maintains records of all civil and criminal court activities, administers jury draw, child support collections, and voter registration, issues marriage licenses and records state tax liens.
service_description: Maintains records of all county-level court cases, and issues marriage licenses. Files petitions for divorce, probate, adoption, name change, child custody, parental visitation, record expungement, and protective orders. Processes payments for child support, foreclosures, court costs, and other judgments. Oversees elections in the county.
site_details: Call or walk in for information.
site_eligibility: Varies by service; serves Whitley County

agency_desc: County veterans service officers are veterans employed by the county to act as liaisons with county residents for veteran issues, including but not limited to; providing forms, information, and assistance in obtaining state and federal veterans benefits.
service_description: Provides information about and assistance with veterans' benefits to veterans, their surviving spouses, and their children. County service officers can assist in the completion and submission of forms necessary to receive all appropriate federal and state veterans' benefits.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_schedule: Mon and Wed 10am-4pm; Tues and Thurs 8am-11:30am
site_eligibility: Veteran, surviving spouses or children of a veteran

agency_desc: A government agency that administers housing assistance programs.
service_description: Offers no-interest loans of up to $20,000 to eligible Columbia City homeowners for the rehabilitation of their homes, including roof repairs, foundation repairs, installing a new furnace, plumbing or electrical work, and more.
site_details: Call for information or walk in to pick up an application. -- Applications can be downloaded from the website.
site_eligibility: Own and occupy the home -- Meet household income guidelines (at or below 100% Area Median Income)
